articles.content: First made in 1954 by Leaudra and Walter Kern along with their son George, the first Derby-Pie® was served to guests at the Melrose Inn in Prospect, Kentucky. Now, more than 60 years later, the Kerns… [+7961 chars]

articles.title: Guitar Center files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection, plans to stay open - USA TODAY
articles.description: Musical instrument retailer Guitar Center has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection after negotiating a debt-cutting deal.
articles.content:

articles.title: Merck to pay $425M for biotech to get Covid-19 drug - STAT
articles.description: The drug giant Merck said it would purchase Rockville, Md.-based OncoImmune in order to obtain the company’s Covid-19 treatment.
articles.content: The drug giant Merck said Monday it would purchase Rockville, Md.-based OncoImmune for $425 million in cash to obtain the company’s treatment for patients hospitalized with severe and critical Covid-… [+1569 chars]

articles.title: Hy-Vee brings back reserved shopping hour for high-risk customers - KCCI Des Moines
articles.description: "We kindly ask that all other customers please respect this hour and limit shopping to 8 a.m. or after on these days," Hy-Vee wrote on Facebook.
articles.content:
DES MOINES, Iowa —Hy-Vee announced it will be bringing back special hours for customers who are high-risk as COVID-19 cases rise in Iowa.
